args.natural_language_statement: Let A ∈ O(n) with column vectors A_1,...,A_n ∈ ℝ^n. Show that A_i · A_j = δ_{ij} for all 1 ≤ i,j ≤ n, where · denotes the standard dot product on ℝ^n.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix

/-- Let A ∈ O(n) with column vectors A_1,...,A_n ∈ ℝ^n. Show that A_i · A_j = δ_{ij} for all 1 ≤ i,j ≤ n, where · denotes the standard dot product on ℝ^n. -/
theorem dotProduct_of_column_vectors_extracted [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] [CommSemiring α] {A : Matrix n n α} :
 A.IsOrtho → ∀ (i j : n), A.toColumns i ⬝ᵥ A.toColumns j = Pi.single i 1 j := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Matrix
open BigOperators

variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

/-- If Aᵀ ⬝ A = 1 then the columns of A are orthonormal: their dot products equal δ_{ij}. -/
theorem orthogonal_matrix_columns_dot (A : Matrix n n ℝ) (h : Aᵀ ⬝ A = 1) :
  ∀ (i j : n), (∑ k, A k i * A k j) = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by
  sorry

import Mathlib
open Matrix
open BigOperators

variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

theorem orthogonal_matrix_columns_dot (A : Matrix n n ℝ) (h : A.transpose ⬝ A = 1) :
  ∀ (i j : n), (∑ k, A k i * A k j) = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

variable {n : Type _} [Fintype n]

/-- If Aᵀ ⬝ A = 1 then the columns of A are orthonormal: their dot products equal δ_{ij}. -/
theorem orthogonal_matrix_columns_dot (A : Matrix n n ℝ) (h : A.transpose ⬝ A = (1 : Matrix n n ℝ)) :
  ∀ (i j : n), (∑ k : n, A k i * A k j) = if i = j then (1 : ℝ) else 0 := by
  sorry

import Mathlib
open BigOperators

theorem orthogonal_matrix_columns_dot {n : Type _} [Fintype n] (A : Matrix n n Real)
  (h : Matrix.transpose A ⬝ A = (1 : Matrix n n Real)) :
  ∀ i j : n, (∑ k : n, A k i * A k j) = if i = j then (1 : Real) else 0 := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

variable {n : Type _} [Fintype n]

theorem lean_test (A : Matrix n n ℝ) : True := by
  trivial
